meanings.definition: A person who holds a life rent in land.
meanings.sent1: The fiar of the estate collected the rent each month.
meanings.sent2: The fiar inherited the land from their ancestors.
meanings.sent3: The fiar decided to plant a beautiful garden on the rented land.
meanings.sent4: As the fiar of the property, she felt a deep connection to the land.
meanings.sent5: The fiar's responsibility was to maintain the land for future generations.

meanings.definition: To grant a life rent in land to.
meanings.sent1: He will fiar the land to his son when he retires.
meanings.sent2: The landlord decided to fiar the property to the tenant for a fixed period.
meanings.sent3: She chose to fiar the land to her sister as a gesture of goodwill.
meanings.sent4: The family decided to fiar the farm to a young couple starting their own business.
meanings.sent5: The landowner agreed to fiar the estate to the local community for conservation purposes.
